bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 85 (Wednesday, May 18, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. WEBSTER of Florida:H.R. 7831.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the United States Constitution[Page H5175]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Internet.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text:
Helping Everyone Access Long Term Healthcare Act or the HEALTH Act

This bill allows a tax deduction for direct primary care physicians who provide charity care. The care must be provided without expectation of reimbursement and to an individual enrolled in Medicaid or the Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP).

A direct primary care physician is a physician who provides primary care (1) to individuals who have paid a periodic subscription fee, and (2) in exchange for a fee that is published on a publicly available website of the physician.

bill.title: HEALTH Act

item.title: Helping Everyone Access Long Term Healthcare Act
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a deduction for certain charity care furnished by physicians, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
